    Team News

    Barcelona
    • Luis Enrique has no injury or suspension concerns coming into the semi final meeting with Bayern Munich.
    • Marc-Andre ter Stegen will resume his cup duties in between the sticks in place of Claudio Bravo.
    • Other than that, Enrique is not expected to spring too many surprises to his starting XI.
    Bayern Munich
    • David Alaba, Arjen Robben and Holger Badstuber all remain sidelined for Bayern.
    • Franck Ribery and Robert Lewandowski are doubts, though the latter should be fine to feature form the off despite suffering a nasty facial injury against Borussia Dortmund last week.
    • Javi Martinez came through the 2-0 defeat at Leverkusen at the weekend unscathed and is an option for Pep Guardiola.

    Prediction

    • Barcelona appear unstoppable at present. The Blaugrana netted 14 times in their last 2 league games, though the welcome of a weakened Bayern will pose a much sterner test than Getafe and Cordoba.
    • Bayern have lost their last 2 competitive games and are on a worrying run of form coming into the meeting with Barcelona. Much of the focus will centre around Pep Guardiola's return to Camp Nou in the opposing dugout for the first time since departing Barcelona as manager and he would like nothing more than a win here to improve Bayern's chances or progressing to the final.
    • However, given the form Barcelona are in - especially in attack - the hosts should come away with victory in this tie.
    Prediction:
    Barcelona
    3
    1
    Bayern Munich
